page.title: 17Being an A.A.Man
page.content: {Neil Horner writes -}My Dad is an A.A. Patrolman. He has to answer calls from the roadside or from homes. If he can he repairs the vehicle, otherwise he arranges recovery to a garage. It is a 24hr service, 365 days a year. The Island has a team of six breakdown patrols with one Inspector and two ladies at the Newport Office. The work load varies greatly with the weather and with traffic volume. Tourists make summer very busy. Heavy rain or severe winter weather will increase the calls for the Breakdown Service. Mostly work is on popular models - cars, vans or motor bikes. Sometimes a more exotic vehicle needs help. Ignition failure is the most common cause of breakdown but anything from punctures to seized engines have to be dealt with ... including an increasing number of keys locked in cars!
